thread.title: Ethics panel says Zimmerman violated campaign finance rules
thread.title_full: Ethics panel says Zimmerman violated campaign finance rules

title: Ethics panel says Zimmerman violated campaign finance rules
text:
Facebook Email Twitter Google+ LinkedIn Pinterest Ethics panel says Zimmerman violated campaign finance rules Austin City Council Member Don Zimmerman has violated the city's campaign finance requirements by failing to file two required end-of-year forms, according to a vote by Austin's Ethics Review Commission Tuesday night. Post to Facebook Ethics panel says Zimmerman violated campaign finance rules Austin City Council Member Don Zimmerman has violated the city's campaign finance requirements by failing to file two required end-of-year forms, according to a vote by Austin's Ethics Review Commission Tuesday night.  //kvue.tv/1RHomrK   Ethics panel says Zimmerman violated campaign finance rules KVUE 7:42 a.m. CDT October 14, 2015 Austin City Council member Don Zimmerman (Photo: Zimmerman's website) CONNECT 1 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
AUSTIN -- Austin City Council Member Don Zimmerman has violated the city's campaign finance requirements by failing to file two required end-of-year forms, according to a vote by Austin's Ethics Review Commission Tuesday night. 
The ethic's commission has limited power and cannot issue fines. However, the commission will send a "letter of reprimand" to the city council. The commission also voted to require that Zimmerman file the reports, but stopped short of recommending prosecution because it was a "minor" offense. 
The forms Zimmerman failed to submit include candidate's final expenditures, donations and remaining funds. 
KVUE's news partners at the Austin American-Statesman report that council members rarely become targeted for ethics complaints outside the campaign season. This is also the first letter of reprimand issued to a sitting city council member since at least August 2011.
